wikipedia_page.main: Jane Sarah Roberts Bell (1798-1873) was a British illustrator.  Her illustrations of the African softshell turtle and pale-throated sloth's bone structures were published in A Monograph of the Testudinata and Transactions of the Zoological Society of London.

response: thumb|Illustration (Plate 17) for one of Bell's articles "Observations on the Neck of the Three-toed Sloth, Bradypus tridactylus, Linn.", by Jane S. Bell
A few of Bell's works were illustrated by Jane, who signed herself Jane S. Bell.
*  – summarizes all the world's turtles, living and extinct. The forty plates are by Jane S. Bell, James de Carle Sowerby and Edward Lear.
